user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_GetReturnStatus:
```c
int OS_BSP_GetReturnStatus(void)
{
    int retcode;

    switch (OS_BSP_Global.AppStatus)
    {
        case OS_SUCCESS:
            /* translate OS_SUCCESS to the system EXIT_SUCCESS value (usually 0) */
            retcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
            break;

        case OS_ERROR:
            /* translate OS_ERROR to the system EXIT_FAILURE value (usually 1) */
            retcode = EXIT_FAILURE;
            break;

        default:
            /* any other value will be passed through (implementation-defined) */
            /* Range is limited to 0-127, however */
            retcode = OS_BSP_Global.AppStatus & 0x7F;
            break;
    }

    return retcode;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
Rule 8.13 concerns pointer declarations/uses: pointers should point to const-qualified types when possible. In this function there are no pointer objects or pointer operations to inspect:
- No pointer declarations (the only local variable is an int: retcode).
- No pointer parameters (function signature returns int, takes void).
- No address-of (& applied here is the bitwise operator on an integer, not the address-of operator: OS_BSP_Global.AppStatus & 0x7F).
- No dereference operations or pointer arithmetic.
- OS_BSP_Global is accessed with the structure/member operator (.) not the pointer operator (->), so within this snippet it is not a pointer.
- No casts to or from pointer types, nor any use of function pointers.
Therefore, based on the provided code fragment, there are no constructs relevant to MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13 to investigate. If additional code (e.g., the definitions of OS_BSP_Global or surrounding modules) introduces pointers, those would need to be examined, but they are not present in this snippet.
